result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Nigel D Walker in court, in custody.  
Attorney Griffis requests another hearing date.

10:22 AM Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nigel D Walker in court.  Attorney Cassandra A Miller Ms. in court for Nigel D Walker. records.addlTxt:
Notice regarding US passport for criminal defendant
The original document name was titled: Notice regarding US passport for criminal defendant
The original history event date is: 08-05-2022
Preliminary hearing on August 10, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives.  Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court.  If the defendant has a passport he is to surrender his passport to the Waukesha Criminal Traffic Office (Room C226) within 24 hours of release from custody.  Defendant is not permitted to apply for the issuance, duplicate nor renewal of a passport and/or passport card during the pendency of this action.

02:05 PM Defendant Nigel D Walker in court, in custody, with attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Niki Kane appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.  Attorney Nimmer indicates Attorney Cassie Miller will be taking this case so a status conference does not need to be set the day prior to the preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 10:15 am.
